meanings.definition: A person who specializes in the study of the microscopic structure of tissues.
meanings.sent1: The histologists carefully analyzed the tissue samples to understand their structure.
meanings.sent2: The histologists work in a lab where they study tiny details of tissues.
meanings.sent3: The histologists joked that they have a 'microscopic' view of the world.
meanings.sent4: To the histologists, tissues are like intricate puzzles waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The histologists' job is like being a detective investigating the secrets of tissues.

meanings.definition: The histologists in the lab examined the tissue samples under the microscope.
meanings.sent1: Under the guidance of the lead histologists, the team studied tissue samples closely.
meanings.sent2: Histologists use microscopes to look at tissues and understand their structure.
meanings.sent3: The histologists were so focused on their work that they didn't notice the time passing.
meanings.sent4: The histologists' lab resembled a tiny world where tissues were the main characters.
meanings.sent5: The histologists' job involves peering into a miniature universe of tissues.

meanings.definition: The histologists' findings were crucial in diagnosing the patient's illness.
meanings.sent1: The hospital relied on the histologists' discoveries to identify the illness affecting the patient.
meanings.sent2: Histologists play a key role in determining what is wrong with a patient based on tissue analysis.
meanings.sent3: The histologists celebrated when their diagnosis helped save a patient's life.
meanings.sent4: The histologists' insights were like a beacon guiding the doctors towards the right treatment.
meanings.sent5: The histologists' work is like putting together pieces of a medical puzzle to help patients.
